basics.name: Osiel Montoya
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering in the Electical and Computer Engineering Department at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2023.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI
Leeward Community College, Pearl City, HI

work.summary: Performed product validation and testing on 400GbE QSFP-DD test appliance
highlights: Collected and analyzed link quality measurements of QSFP-DD/QSFP56 interconnects at various emphasis settings in order to achieve optimal performance
Completed transition of customer-facing Interconnect Support List to new, simpler to understand format, verifying the accuracy of 897 interconnect entries
Collected measurements of optical transciver link quality at elevated operating temperatures to determine effect on link stability and error rate
Provide individual instructional assistance and support for students in Algebra, Geometry, and Calculus using analogy, visual diagrams, and other teaching skills
Maintain records of tutoring duration and feedback surveys

work.summary: Served as Radio Technician and Electronic Test Equipment Custodian
highlights: Troubleshoot, diagnose, and repair faults on AN/WSC-6(V)7 SHF Satellite Communications Radios, AN/WSC-3(V)7,11,15,3A UHF Communications Radios, and other various communications and RADAR systems
Organization-Level inventory manager of Electronic Test Equipment such as multimeters, oscilloscopes, and signal generators, responsible for inventory and calibration readiness.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Awarded to students completing the semester of at least 12 credits with a semester GPA of 3.5.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Awarded to students completing the semester of at least 6 credits with a semester GPA of 3.0, and cumulative GPA of 3.8.
